chunks.zh: 深圳电动自行车载人要开罚单了？
chunks.en: Shenzhen will start issuing tickets for carrying passengers on electric bicycles?

chunks.zh: 早上被交警拦住了，说载人超过 1.2m 了，给开了罚单。
chunks.en: I was stopped by the traffic police this morning, who said that carrying a person exceeded 1.2m and issued a ticket.

chunks.zh: 目前，没查到具体这条规定的依据。
chunks.en: Currently, I haven't found the basis for this specific regulation.

chunks.zh: 我宁愿他们严管，然后推动法规修正完善，而不是模棱两可。
chunks.en: I would rather they strictly manage and then promote the amendment and improvement of regulations, rather than being ambiguous.

chunks.zh: 现在都不知道算什么，说不给搭人，却到处都是搭客的电鸡。
chunks.en: I don't know what it is now. They say no passengers are allowed, but there are electric bikes carrying passengers everywhere.

chunks.zh: 说电鸡只能走非机，却没人管非机的机动车违停。
chunks.en: They say electric bikes can only use non-motor vehicle lanes, but no one cares about motor vehicles illegally parked in non-motor vehicle lanes.

chunks.zh: 行人更惨，完全没有路权。
chunks.en: Pedestrians are even worse, with no right of way at all.

chunks.zh: 最惨的只有老实人。
chunks.en: The worst off are the honest people.

chunks.zh: 有法可依，执法必严，成了笑话。
chunks.en: 'There is a law to abide by, and the law must be strictly enforced' has become a joke.

chunks.zh: 那些拉客的呢？
chunks.en: What about those who solicit passengers?

chunks.zh: @hailaz 现在深圳走路是最惨的，提心吊胆
chunks.en: @hailaz Walking in Shenzhen now is the worst, very nerve-wracking

chunks.zh: 考一次科目一就知道这条了
chunks.en: You'll know this rule once you take the theory test.

chunks.zh: 成年人驾驶自行车、电动车自行车，在确保安全的前提下，在城市区道路上可以载 1 名 12 周岁以下未成年人，在其他道路上载人不得超过一人。
chunks.en: Adults driving bicycles or electric bicycles can carry one child under the age of 12 on urban roads, provided it is safe. Carrying passengers on other roads is limited to one person.

chunks.zh: 西安也罚，载人罚 20 。
chunks.en: Xi'an also fines for carrying passengers, 20 yuan.

chunks.zh: 电动自行车不能载 12 岁以上的，摩托车不能载未成年。
chunks.en: Electric bicycles cannot carry people over 12 years old, and motorcycles cannot carry minors.

chunks.zh: 全国很多城市其实很早都有类似规定，我一直觉得之前都是选择性执法，管得不严而已。
chunks.en: Many cities across the country actually had similar regulations a long time ago. I always felt that enforcement was selective and not strict.

chunks.zh: 《广东省道路安全条例》第 37 条、第 55 条。https://www.gd.gov.cn/zwgk/wjk/zcfgk/content/post_2531572.html第三十七条　自行车、电动自行车在城市市区道路上不得载人，但安装有固定安全座椅的，可以附载一名身高一点二米以下儿童。在其他道路上载人不得超过一人。第五十五条  ... 非机动车驾驶人违反道路交通安全法律、行政法规和本条例关于道路通行规定的，处警告或者二十元罚款；但有下列行为之一的，责令改正，处警告或者五十元罚款: ... （三）违反规定载人，或者行驶时速超过十五公里的；)
chunks.en: Articles 37 and 55 of the Guangdong Province Road Safety Regulations. https://www.gd.gov.cn/zwgk/wjk/zcfgk/content/post_2531572.html Article 37: Bicycles and electric bicycles are not allowed to carry passengers on urban roads, but if a fixed safety seat is installed, they can carry a child under 1.2 meters in height. Carrying passengers on other roads is limited to one person. Article 55: ... Non-motor vehicle drivers who violate road traffic safety laws, administrative regulations, and these regulations regarding road traffic rules shall be given a warning or a fine of 20 yuan; however, for any of the following behaviors, they shall be ordered to make corrections and given a warning or a fine of 50 yuan: ... (3) Violating the regulations by carrying passengers or driving at a speed exceeding 15 kilometers per hour;)

chunks.zh: 不是一直要罚的么，我们这边 18 年就开始罚载人了
chunks.en: Hasn't it always been fined? We started fining people for carrying other people in 2018.

chunks.zh: 杭州电动自行车(包括自行车)带 12 岁以上的，一直抓 一直罚款啊
chunks.en: In Hangzhou, electric bicycles (including bicycles) carrying people over 12 years old have always been caught and fined.

chunks.zh: 咳，我更羡慕深圳，可以合法骑电动车。
chunks.en: Sigh, I envy Shenzhen more, where you can legally ride electric bikes.

chunks.zh: 在厦门岛内，电动车不能上牌不能骑，处于灰色地带，想抓你就抓你，不想抓你就不抓你，搞得我不敢买电动车。
chunks.en: In Xiamen Island, electric vehicles cannot be licensed or ridden, they are in a gray area, they can catch you if they want to, and if they don't want to, they won't catch you, which makes me afraid to buy an electric vehicle.

chunks.zh: @qoo2019 最近才知道，交警对于没车牌的电驴连头盔也不管的
chunks.en: @qoo2019 I recently found out that the traffic police don't even care about helmets for electric donkeys without license plates.

chunks.zh: @xscc 那看来上牌只是为了管理老实人了
chunks.en: @xscc It seems that licensing is just to manage honest people.

chunks.zh: @zhouquanbest 我科一题库刷穿都见过这题😂
chunks.en: @zhouquanbest I've seen this question even after going through the entire theory test question bank 😂

chunks.zh: @essethon 看来之前只是不抓而已，我来来回回经过那么多交警，没人管的，唯一一次被拦下来是看有没上牌。
chunks.en: @essethon It seems that they just didn't catch it before. I passed so many traffic police back and forth, and no one cared. The only time I was stopped was to see if I had a license plate.

chunks.zh: 搞笑的是，早上我在登记信息的同时，有个车两人不带头盔，还逆行的，交警去拦，人家不理，加速跑了。
chunks.en: The funny thing is, this morning while I was registering my information, there was a car with two people without helmets, and they were also going against the traffic. When the traffic police went to stop them, they ignored them and sped away.

chunks.zh: @zhouquanbest 6 年前考的，真没见过有这道题。
chunks.en: @zhouquanbest I took the test 6 years ago and never saw this question.

chunks.zh: 上海早就不允许了，只能载小孩
chunks.en: Shanghai has long disallowed it, you can only carry children.

chunks.zh: 等红绿灯别停路口就得了，停后面远点，绿灯了开快快的 拦你当做没看到直接开走
chunks.en: When waiting for traffic lights, don't stop at the intersection, stop further back. When the light turns green, drive quickly and pretend you don't see them stopping you and drive away.

chunks.zh: @zhouquanbest 现在科目一还考电动自行车的题目的吗
chunks.en: @zhouquanbest Does the theory test now test electric bicycle questions?

chunks.zh: @freezebreze 不是红绿灯路口，是在路上幼儿园门口，直接示意停车。
chunks.en: @freezebreze It's not a traffic light intersection, it was on the road near the kindergarten entrance, they directly signaled to stop.

chunks.zh: 之前也有过类似，不过只是问了有没上牌而已，今天直接开罚单。
chunks.en: There have been similar situations before, but they only asked if I had a license plate. Today, they directly issued a ticket.

chunks.zh: 正常规定就是不让载人的，为什么这么肯定，因为在广州我是真被罚过
chunks.en: The normal regulation is that you are not allowed to carry people. Why am I so sure? Because I was actually fined in Guangzhou.
